alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Martin, northeastern Floyd and northwestern Pike Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 927 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gulnare, or 9 miles north of Pikeville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Piso around 935 PM EDT. Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Coal Run and Osborn around 945 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Meta, Zebulon, Raccoon, Chloe, Shelbiana and Kimper. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 12 and 13. U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 12. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 16 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
